text:
Hello everyone,
Any news on the ["TypeError: customerPayload.main is not a function" error.
I'm getting it also when I'm using webpack to build the function file that I push in the HubSpot instance

And here is my function.
The functions works when not compiled by Webpack

The following API makes it seem like it can associate a contact to another contact.  I get the following error: "status": "error",
    "message": "contact_to_contact is not a valid association type between contacts and contacts",
Hey <@U016VA81REH> sorry for the confusion, we’ll work on getting the docs updated since you cannot create a contact to contact association as you found out.

Hey <@UKQP9KM8A> in short, this was done because it means we can support a number of languages without a lot of effort. I’ve passed the feedback along to the team that helps generate the library. At the same time, don’t hesitate to create an issue or open a PR, we definitely want to help make this usable
Is there any road map to allowing that?
No concrete plans right now. It’s something we’ve talked about allowing for things like parent/child companies. Are you just exploring or have something specific in mind you’d like to accomplish?

Something specific in Mind.  We are working on a project and we want to track contact to contact associations.  We are currently in the Custom Objects Beta so I have been looking into doing it that way but saw the new v3 API and wanted to see if that was an option.
Gotcha, yeah I think it would probably be more “correct” to have associations between contacts since you can’t email a custom object. Just not something we can accommodate at the moment.

We have a client who has an API endpoint that is creating 40 companies in the portal every night at 3am and they have no idea what the API is. Is there a way to find the specific API that is doing this? The API call log doesnt have a call that relates to the same time as creation

hi all!
we need to connect many HubSpot accounts (clients) using OAuth to our app which runs on Firebase.  my question is can we use OAuth without putting our app into the public marketplace?
Can someone send me example framework of HubSpot posting data to a third party application via CRM Card
Hey Andrey, absolutely. Apps are by default unlisted, and you never have to go through the process to list

<@UKN05SLNR> ok, but how setup client's HubSpot account to establish a connection without listed app.
I cannot find any info .
There are only 2 variants in docs: 
1)Apikey 
2)Oauth - the docs says we must list an app .
Could you help me please
